intro: Caladenia roei, commonly known as the Red-tongued Spider-orchid, is a striking terrestrial orchid native to southwestern Western Australia. It features a single, slender stem that typically grows to a height of about 30–50 centimeters. The plant produces a single, showy flower with a deep red lip and a pale yellow to green dorsal sepal. Its habitat consists of sandy soils in open heathlands and woodlands. Caladenia roei is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in areas with well-drained soil and full sun exposure.
